title: How can someone prove that not everything happens for a reason? - Quora

response.answer_text: This hypothesis cannot be proven by observation. For if we made zillions of observations, and each observation demonstrated that the observed event happened for a reason, we would still not be able to be absolutely sure that the very next observation will concern an event that happened for a reason. However, the hypothesis can be shown to be shaky by means of observations. For if an outcome happens for a reason, there is a cause for that outcome, such that the cause will ensure that a repetition of the initial state will produce the same final state, other things being equal. No observations of ‘collapses of wave functions’ in quantum mechanics demonstrate such repetitive behavior. The hypothesis can also be shown to be shaky by means of logical argument, as follows. Either the universe came into existence out of absolute nothingness, or the universe has always existed in some form or other. In the first case, there can be no reason for the initial state of the universe. In the latter case, there can be no reason for the universe always having existed. Now for a bit of philosophy of everyday life: Perhaps you should abandon the hypothesis. That will probably make you easier to get on with. People who just cannot accept that some things happen for no reason are apt to find reasons even when there are none, and are likely to blame some innocent party as a result.

You could delude yourself into thinking you found it if you looked ‘hard’ enough. Usually everything happens for a reason is accompanied by ‘this one thing happened so that second thing could occur.’ Edit: The reason being alluded to usually is the second thing. It's not the first thing(which actually happened before the second.) So I guess in someway you could say the second thing is the proof, which in Interstellar language is proving your own proof, which is nonsensical. It's always in retrospect and cannot point to a direct cause. So we have to reason why that thing happened. I find most of the why questions to this answer arise out of a need for validation. “Why did the asteroid have to hit at that particular moment in time when Dinosaurs were walking the earth? Because it had to clear the way for human evolution. Everything happens for a reason.” *At this point, I am making forehead contact with the wall* You see the question doesn't make sense. The asteroid hit earth, plain fact. Why - because it was on a collision course. In a chaotic universe that happens. Statistically speaking, it is normal. We evolved because all other conditions including all past events were conducive to our evolution. That is all. We are not special.

There are things that happen for a reason, but it's rarely the reason that's ascribed to them. If you live in a western country, you enjoy a standard of health and economic prosperity that has little to do with you personally or any deity you might pray to, and has everything to do with those that went before you in the scientific/industrial revolution that has transformed our world. Do you really want to prove that not everything happens for a reason? Visit a hospice. Say hello to a complete stranger dying prematurely from cancer. Buy some flowers and go and brighten someone's dying day. You'll come away with tears in your eyes and a newfound sense of respect for the frailty of life and the tragic waste that is death. Is there a reason that person has cancer? Sure, but it can be as mundane as the natural background radiation caused a minor mutation in their DNA.

Yes. There is a scientific proof. And everything happens for multiple reasons. The main scientific reason? We are here because we are creating, developing, making, building up, constructing, erecting the Past of the Future. The Present is just the Past of the Future. And we all know that without present, could not there be future. And we all live only in the present.  Let’s use the Fiction to explain a scientific reality. Imagine that this idea of fiction becomes true: Fiction: Someone, named Goddito, with immense powers, has a magic wand full of buttons. The magic wand has an amber button named Don’tTouchMe, that, when pushed during 6,66 seconds all human activity is totally paralyzed. And Goddito pushes the amber button during 6,66 seconds because he wants to prove that I am wrong. And obviously, I can not be wrong because I am creating my own Fiction. And all humans will become petrified, fixed, motionless, but still alive without any activity, for one hundred years. It is a state of A Full Emptiness. Or An Empty Fullness. But time does not stop. Stopping Time is one of the ten things that God can not do. But Goddito, in the fiction, can do anything he wants. ¿Is fiction bigger than God? Ask God. One hundred years later the button is played again when Mellopsia, that famous mysterious planet, bla, bla, bla, and we resume our activity. We are not aware that we have spent the last hundred years petrified. What has happened during those one hundred years without any human activity? And there is no proof that one hundred years have passed through A Full Emptiness. Everything happens now, in the Present, for a REAL reason. And for many more reasons. AND EVERYTHING HAPPENS FOR MANY REASONS AND ONE OF THE MAIN REASONS IS: WE ARE HERE BUILDING THE PAST OF THE FUTURE. OR: We are here formatting and giving life to the Past of the Future. And it's one more reason why EVERYTHING happens because there's a reason for it to happen. Even if we still do not know why there has to be a reason and what is that reason. At least from a human point of view. And humans have many points of view.  Thanks so much for your upvotes. I never thought they were important. They really are important. Corrections & improvements in my English are most welcome. I have this Facebook page Veri S Daughter dedicated to all my answers in Quora for Spanish.

Yes and no. Everything is caused by something, and this is not controversial. So, in this way everything happens for a reason. But I suspect you mean a greater reason, a plan, that has somehow been put in place by someone, somewhere. The great Architect of the universe. The Director of the symphony of life. This may seem reasonable, but it falls apart when we look carefully. Let me choose one direction to look. You were once a baby, but that baby is dead and gone. Where is that baby? The baby that you once were is not. It does not exist. Period. There is no past. What is gone is gone, and it is irretrievable. Similarly, there is no future. There never has been and there never will be. Since there is no future, there can be no plan. Oh, we can make up fantasies in our head and suppose one future or another, but that is simply a game of our mind. There is no future. There is only is. There is only this infinitesimal moment, and when it is gone, we are dead and reborn in a new form. You have died and been reborn more times than there are stars in the heavens, and you are not the person who started to read my little answer. Whose plan was that?

There's not even proof things happen for no-reason, let alone a reason. We apply meaning to chaos because we crave order and explanation. It is a human trick of the mind as it provides us with a deluded feeling of control and safety. Look around and you'll see all the apparatus of control we've created, most of it determined to control other people. It's one of the biggest myths of existence and feeds into those with the whip hand, by keeping people in line whilst depriving them of basic rights and necessities.

Certain events cause other events to happen, but no, there is no ‘reason’ beyond the fact that physics works the way it works, and the earth works the way it works, and water runs downhill. Things happen. People FIND ‘reasons’. Reasons, in that sense, are not answers, just ‘explanations’ of meaning. We love to have meaning. We want everything to mean something. We always want there to be a REASON for human suffering, in particular. But there is no way to prove that sort of meaning. People create that kind of meaning, to help us survive disaster and difficulty.

I have always heard this but I do not believe it. Some times things just happened. Even more often we should have been able to predict it. But you can ALWAYS make something beautiful out of something that happens, as if it really did happen for a reason. This requires creativity and courage.

Quantum leaps are the only thing about which we're not entirely certain that it happens for a reason. Everything else has a reason, but the reason is related to physics and not the romantic version of fate.  If I knew a proof of indeterminism at the quantum level, I'd be soooo happy.

Anytime you can find things that occur following ironclad laws you can say they happen because of such laws; the modern philosophy of science makes all such laws contingent on future findings but no doubt some like the conservation of momentum and the like are not expected by anyone to change (but that was said about the laws of physics before Einstein and Bohr et al, too). But “everything” is a bit broad. Quantum effects seem random. “A reason” beyond the above is a human concept of meaning rather than a logical progression. God has left finding meaning to us.

No. I don’t think anyone can prove that this theory is fact or fiction. It remains a personal belief in my estimation. While I don’t personally believe that everything happens for a reason, but I certainly would never put anyone down for believing it.

If you mean “do all effects have causes”, it would appear to be so in this universe. That’s not to say it’s true in wherever this universe started (it, indeed, it hasn’t always existed in some form and the Big Bang was just the start of the current form). If you mean “For the same reason, like a god”, not only is there no proof, there’s no objective evidence at all. Plenty of belief, but no objective evidence.

Causality is a general undisputed principle or fact; things happen which sets off a chain of events, causing other things, and on and on. As for a root cause, you could theoretically go back to the “Big Bang”; however, this is also in contention as we do not know what caused it. You cannot confuse causality with purpose or design however. Causality and its mistaken association with evolution moves people to think of it as a liberal theory. Causality is simply a linear progression of cause and effect without regard to what the cause is; therefore, every event is assumed to have some cause. With respect to there being a divine design or purpose for life, events, or the universe in general, that is a metaphysical concern that is answered by various religions and faiths. It is up to every individual to evaluate life for themselves and come up with their own answers. RAH

“Every action has an equal or opposite reaction” Newtons third law states that every action has a reaction. I know the law technically applies to physics, but it can be applied to real life. The reason something happens is not in order that something will happen in the future, but rather because you did something in the past.

Of course this negative statement cannot be proven.  The idea does have some implications. Usually when people say that everything happens for a reason, it means that everything happens for a predetermined reason.  Which means there is little or no free will.

I absolutely believe that, as in my life there have been numerous examples. Though people usually think that if something happened it must be with its outcome, for example: you and your boyfriend broke up, but you know both of you have feelings for each other. Maybe it was meant to happened and did for the reason of not that you are not meant to be with each other, rather to realise that something needs to be resolved and learn from it, and be together.

Hi, There are more than millions of proofs available in the human history…few are Respected APJ Abdul Kalam sir wanted to join Indian Air Force. But he got rejected by IAF ( pls read book “ wings of fire”)Sundar pichai didn't qualify upsc. Now CEO of googleRavish kumar didn't qualify upsc. Now Star anchor of NDTVWalt Disney was not good at study but world know him for his creativityManoj Bajpayee got rejected 4 times by NSD. Now everyone knows him and his reputation as an actor.I can add thousands of points here but most important is if one example is available then one should learn from it.

Pascal's wager trumps the question. The argument that it is in one's own best interest to behave as if God exists, since the possibility of eternal punishment in hell outweighs any advantage of believing otherwise.  OR...Quora constraints on freedom of speech prohibit this truthful answer from surfacing because it maligns the ill intent of using chance as an excuse for an undisciplined life.  OR...If God behaves as a gentleman and offers true free will, then only a reasonable man would consider the same God to have the power to enforce justice on those who abuse their God given freedom.  OR...A world without God is a devil's playground and no one is safe.

Yes I believe so. Quantum physics clearly shows us there is no such thing as tome & space. Not just in theory but experiments & the most important piece of Technology completely based upon it existing - the transistor. It means the self awareness of the universe has patterns that dictate there is an order to things > John Penturn's answer to Are there any theories of a self aware universe not within the context of philosophy and metaphysics?
It's all cause and effect so if you find a solid reason why cause and effect is false then you're on the path to proving not everything happens for a reason.

Yes, of course there is lots of proof as I'm giving answer of your question because I want to give and share my opinion. If you truly need proof just observe your routine that whatever you do there is a reason behind it like you ask this question because you want an answer. It's like a cycle that there is a reason behind reason.you ask questions because you need answers,.other questions arise why you need answers because you want to do depth study new question arise that why you want to do depth study means ultimately it's never ending process.

Yes. Otherwise there would only be rapid descent into chaos. On a more technical note, there are DIVINE MAGNETICS at play resulting from the interplay of different levels and entities of consciousness at different levels. On reason this issue confuses people is because your FREE-WILL, one might, say is MULTI-DIMENSIONAL. There is a “you” during sleep that is more expansive than waking you, and this “you’ may agree to events and connections. etc. that conscious you is not aware of.. yet you agreed to them. These will-based agreements or contracts also occur per-incarnationally.. so many occurrences that appear bizarre or random.. are actually logical life experiences you planned or agreed to outside of your own waking awareness. Plus, along a similar vein, you have fractures within self in your sub-conscious (one might say) that also have magnetic power to draw events and people (good or bad) into your life. For example, if you feel powerless at a deep subconscious level, you will tend to draw into your life situations and people who appear to victimize you. Of course, that is only because you are a magnetic match to those looking to victimize. Get rid of that deep belief, and these people will auto-magically no longer target you. PEACE :)
everything happens for a reason. the reason is the state of the universe that came before. random things do not happen to steer the history of the universe into a specific direction.

If that "Reasoning" be by Cause & Effect, -most certainly. Because everything that "Happens" is prompted by Something ELSE. But if that "Reasoning" be by a "plan", or the influence of a "Higher Power", - I rather doubt it. As I can't imagine any "Higher Power" wanting to be so intent on micro-managing the everyday lives of SO many people- both ONE Way, & the Other.

My friend, she lives in Australia since 1990, use to say: “Who knows why is/was that good!* Her argument is: “if I didn't break up with my ex-boyfriend, that night, I would never meet my husband, and we would have never emigrated to Australia!* It's hard to go against that kind of reasoning! :-)
YEPP!!! THE BIBLE TELLS US SO!!!HE KNOWS ALL ABOUT US, EVEN BEFORE WE WERE BORN!!!!TRUST, OBEY, LOVE ONE ANOTHER, PRAISE GOD, AND PRAY IN JESUS NAME…<3

Of course not. And there is lots of evidence to the contrary, Not only is there randomness at the quantum level, but many macroscopic events have no reason, Why are innocent bystanders killed by drunk drivers or terrorists? Or children killed by cancer?
FAITH is all the proof you need to believe!!
No there isn’t.
faith
